df-line
blocks.content: Definition of lines passing through two different points in a left module (or any extended structure having a base set, an addition, and a scalar multiplication). (Contributed by AV, 14-Jan-2023.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-line(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cline, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpo(s1, s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cdif(cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), csn(cv(s1))), crab(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wrex(s4, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s3), co(co(co(cfv(cur, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), cfv(csg, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), cv(s4)), cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), co(cv(s4), cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), cv(s2)))))))))
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-line(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ LineM =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà(Base ` s0), s2 ‚àà((Base ` s0)\ { s1 })‚Ü¶ { s3 ‚àà(Base ` s0)| ‚àÉ(s4 ‚àà(Base `(Scalar ` s0)), s3 =((((1r `(Scalar ` s0))[(-g `(Scalar ` s0))]s4)[(√ó ` s0)]s1)[(+ ` s0)](s4[(√ó ` s0)]s2)))}))
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
}

blocks.name: df-sph
blocks.content: Definition of spheres for given centers and radii in a metric space (or more generally, in a distance space, see ~ distspace , or even in any extended structure having a base set and a distance function into the real numbers. (Contributed by AV, 14-Jan-2023.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-sph(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(csph, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpo(s1, s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), co(nat0, cicc, cpnf), crab(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wceq(co(cv(s3), cfv(cds, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cv(s2))))))
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-sph(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ Sphere =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà(Base ` s0), s2 ‚àà(0[[,]]+‚àû)‚Ü¶ { s3 ‚àà(Base ` s0)|(s3[(dist ` s0)]s1)= s2 }))
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
}

blocks.name: rrxlinesc
blocks.content: Definition of lines passing through two different points in a generalized real Euclidean space of finite dimension, expressed by their coordinates. (Contributed by AV, 13-Feb-2023.)

blocks.name: rrxlinec
blocks.content: The line passing through the two different points ` X ` and ` Y ` in a generalized real Euclidean space of finite dimension, expressed by its coordinates. Remark: This proof is shorter and requires less distinct variables than the proof using ~ rrxlinesc . (Contributed by AV, 13-Feb-2023.)

blocks.name: eenglngeehlnm
blocks.content: The line definition in the Tarski structure for the Euclidean geometry (see ~ elntg ) corresponds to the definition of lines passing through two different points in a left module (see ~ rrxlines ). (Contributed by AV, 16-Feb-2023.)

blocks.name: rrx2linesl
blocks.content: The line passing through the two different points ` X ` and ` Y ` in a real Euclidean space of dimension 2, expressed by the slope ` S ` between the two points ("point-slope form"), sometimes also written as ` ( ( p `` 2 ) - ( X `` 2 ) ) = ( S x. ( ( p `` 1 ) - ( X `` 1 ) ) ) ` . (Contributed by AV, 22-Jan-2023.)

blocks.name: 2sphere
blocks.content: The sphere with center ` M ` and radius ` R ` in a two dimensional Euclidean space is a circle. (Contributed by AV, 5-Feb-2023.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: 2sphere0
blocks.content: The sphere around the origin ` .0. ` (see ~ rrx0 ) with radius ` R ` in a two dimensional Euclidean space is a circle. (Contributed by AV, 5-Feb-2023.)

blocks.name: line2ylem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ line2y . This proof is based on counterexamples for the following cases: 1. ` C =/= 0 ` : p = (0,0) (LHS of bicondional is false, RHS is true); 2. ` C = 0 /\ B =/= 0 ` : p = (1,-A/B) (LHS of bicondional is true, RHS is false); 3. ` A = B = C = 0 ` : p = (1,1) (LHS of bicondional is true, RHS is false). (Contributed by AV, 4-Feb-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm line2ylem(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {

  -| wceq(c4, cpr(nat1, nat2))
  -| wceq(c3, co(cr, cmap, c4))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {

blocks.name: line2xlem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ line2x . This proof is based on counterexamples for the following cases: 1. ` M =/= ( C / B ) ` : p = (0,C/B) (LHS of bicondional is true, RHS is false); 2. ` A =/= 0 /\ M = ( C / B ) ` : p = (1,C/B) (LHS of bicondional is false, RHS is true). (Contributed by AV, 4-Feb-2023.)

blocks.name: line2x
blocks.content: Example for a horizontal line ` G ` passing through two different points in "standard form". (Contributed by AV, 3-Feb-2023.)

blocks.name: line2y
blocks.content: Example for a vertical line ` G ` passing through two different points in "standard form". (Contributed by AV, 3-Feb-2023.)

blocks.name: itsclc0lem1
blocks.content: Lemma for theorems about intersections of lines and circles in a real Euclidean space of dimension 2 . (Contributed by AV, 2-May-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm itsclc0lem1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(w3a(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wa(wcel(c3, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c3)), wa(wcel(c4, cr), wne(c4, nat0))), wcel(co(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c3))), cdiv, c4), cr))
} = {
  redivcld(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c3))), c4, w3a(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wa(wcel(c3, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c3)), wa(wcel(c4, cr), wne(c4, nat0))))
  3adant3(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wa(wcel(c3, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c3)), wa(wcel(c4, cr), wne(c4, nat0)), wcel(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c3))), cr))
  readdcld(co(c0, cmul, c2), co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c3)), wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wa(wcel(c3, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c3))))
  adantr(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wa(wcel(c3, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c3)), wcel(co(c0, cmul, c2), cr))
  3adant2(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr), wcel(co(c0, cmul, c2), cr))
  remulcl(c0, c2)
  remulcld(c1, cfv(csqrt, c3), wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wa(wcel(c3, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c3))))
  simpl2(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr), wa(wcel(c3, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c3)))
  adantl(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wa(wcel(c3, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c3)), wcel(cfv(csqrt, c3), cr))
  resqrtcl(c3)
  simp3l(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wa(wcel(c3, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c3)), wcel(c4, cr), wne(c4, nat0))
  simp3r(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wa(wcel(c3, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c3)), wcel(c4, cr), wne(c4, nat0))
}

blocks.name: itsclc0yqe
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ itsclc0 . Quadratic equation for the y-coordinate of the intersection points of an arbitrary line and a circle. This theorem holds even for degenerate lines ( ` A = B = 0 ` ). (Contributed by AV, 25-Feb-2023.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: itschlc0xyqsol
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ itsclc0 . Solutions of the quadratic equations for the coordinates of the intersection points of a horizontal line and a circle. (Contributed by AV, 8-Feb-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm itschlc0xyqsol(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  |- wi(w3a(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wa(wceq(c0, nat0), wne(c1, nat0))), wa(wcel(c3, crp), wbr(nat0, cle, c4)), wa(wcel(c5, cr), wcel(c6, cr))), wi(wa(wceq(co(co(c5, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c6, cexp, nat2)), co(c3, cexp, nat2)), wceq(co(co(c0, cmul, c5), caddc, co(c1, cmul, c6)), c2)), wo(wa(wceq(c5, co(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7)), wceq(c6, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7))), wa(wceq(c5, co(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7)), wceq(c6, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c0, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7))))))
  -| wceq(c7, co(co(c0, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c1, cexp, nat2)))
  -| wceq(c4, co(co(co(c3, cexp, nat2), cmul, c7), cmin, co(c2, cexp, nat2)))
} = {
  syld(w3a(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wa(wceq(c0, nat0), wne(c1, nat0))), wa(wcel(c3, crp), wbr(nat0, cle, c4)), wa(wcel(c5, cr), wcel(c6, cr))), wa(wceq(co(co(c5, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c6, cexp, nat2)), co(c3, cexp, nat2)), wceq(co(co(c0, cmul, c5), caddc, co(c1, cmul, c6)), c2)), wo(wa(wceq(c5, co(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7)), wceq(c6, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7))), wa(wceq(c5, co(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7)), wceq(c6, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c0, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7)))), wa(wceq(c6, co(c2, cdiv, c1)), wo(wceq(c5, cneg(co(cfv(csqrt, c4), cdiv, c1))), wceq(c5, co(cfv(csqrt, c4), cdiv, c1)))))
  itschlc0xyqsol1(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c7)
  expimpd(w3a(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wa(wceq(c0, nat0), wne(c1, nat0))), wa(wcel(c3, crp), wbr(nat0, cle, c4)), wa(wcel(c5, cr), wcel(c6, cr))), wceq(c6, co(c2, cdiv, c1)), wo(wceq(c5, cneg(co(cfv(csqrt, c4), cdiv, c1))), wceq(c5, co(cfv(csqrt, c4), cdiv, c1))), wo(wa(wceq(c5, co(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7)), wceq(c6, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7))), wa(wceq(c5, co(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7)), wceq(c6, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c0, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7)))))

blocks.name: itsclc0xyqsol
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ itsclc0 . Solutions of the quadratic equations for the coordinates of the intersection points of a (nondegenerate) line and a circle. (Contributed by AV, 25-Feb-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm itsclc0xyqsol(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  |- wi(w3a(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wo(wne(c0, nat0), wne(c1, nat0))), wa(wcel(c3, crp), wbr(nat0, cle, c4)), wa(wcel(c5, cr), wcel(c6, cr))), wi(wa(wceq(co(co(c5, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c6, cexp, nat2)), co(c3, cexp, nat2)), wceq(co(co(c0, cmul, c5), caddc, co(c1, cmul, c6)), c2)), wo(wa(wceq(c5, co(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7)), wceq(c6, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7))), wa(wceq(c5, co(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7)), wceq(c6, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c0, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7))))))
  -| wceq(c7, co(co(c0, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c1, cexp, nat2)))
  -| wceq(c4, co(co(co(c3, cexp, nat2), cmul, c7), cmin, co(c2, cexp, nat2)))
} = {
  3imp(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wo(wne(c0, nat0), wne(c1, nat0))), wa(wcel(c3, crp), wbr(nat0, cle, c4)), wa(wcel(c5, cr), wcel(c6, cr)), wi(wa(wceq(co(co(c5, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c6, cexp, nat2)), co(c3, cexp, nat2)), wceq(co(co(c0, cmul, c5), caddc, co(c1, cmul, c6)), c2)), wo(wa(wceq(c5, co(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7)), wceq(c6, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7))), wa(wceq(c5, co(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7)), wceq(c6, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c0, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7))))))

  jaoi3(wne(c0, nat0), wne(c1, nat0), wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wi(wa(wcel(c3, crp), wbr(nat0, cle, c4)), wi(wa(wcel(c5, cr), wcel(c6, cr)), wi(wa(wceq(co(co(c5, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c6, cexp, nat2)), co(c3, cexp, nat2)), wceq(co(co(c0, cmul, c5), caddc, co(c1, cmul, c6)), c2)), wo(wa(wceq(c5, co(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7)), wceq(c6, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7))), wa(wceq(c5, co(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7)), wceq(c6, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c0, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c4))), cdiv, c7)))))))))

blocks.name: itsclinecirc0
blocks.content: The intersection points of a line through two different points ` Y ` and ` Z ` and a circle around the origin, using the definition of a line in a two dimensional Euclidean space. (Contributed by AV, 25-Feb-2023.) (Proof shortened by AV, 16-May-2023.)

blocks.name: itsclinecirc0in
blocks.content: The intersection points of a line through two different points and a circle around the origin, using the definition of a line in a two dimensional Euclidean space, expressed as intersection. (Contributed by AV, 7-May-2023.) (Revised by AV, 14-May-2023.)

blocks.name: itsclquadeu
blocks.content: Quadratic equation for the y-coordinate of the intersection points of a line and a circle. (Contributed by AV, 23-Feb-2023.)

thm 2itscplem1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {

blocks.name: 2itscp
blocks.content: A condition for a quadratic equation with real coefficients (for the intersection points of a line with a circle) to have (exactly) two different real solutions. (Contributed by AV, 5-Mar-2023.) (Revised by AV, 16-May-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2itscp(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(nat0, clt, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cr))
  -| wceq(c5, co(c3, cmin, c1))
  -| wceq(c6, co(c2, cmin, c4))
  -| wceq(c7, co(co(c5, cmul, c2), caddc, co(c6, cmul, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c8, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c2, cexp, nat2)), clt, co(c8, cexp, nat2)))
  -| wi(w0, wo(wne(c2, c4), wne(c1, c3)))
  -| wceq(c9, co(co(c6, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c5, cexp, nat2)))
  -| wceq(c0, co(co(co(c8, cexp, nat2), cmul, c9), cmin, co(c7, cexp, nat2)))
} = {
  breqtrrd(nat0, clt, c0, co(co(co(co(c6, cexp, nat2), cmul, co(co(c8, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c1, cexp, nat2))), caddc, co(co(c5, cexp, nat2), cmul, co(co(c8, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c2, cexp, nat2)))), cmin, co(nat2, cmul, co(co(c5, cmul, c1), cmul, co(c6, cmul, c2)))), w0)
  mpbid(w0, wbr(nat0, clt, co(co(co(co(c6, cexp, nat2), cmul, co(co(c8, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c1, cexp, nat2))), caddc, co(co(c5, cexp, nat2), cmul, co(co(c8, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c2, cexp, nat2)))), cmin, co(nat2, cmul, co(co(c5, cmul, c1), cmul, co(c6, cmul, c2))))), wbr(co(nat2, cmul, co(co(c5, cmul, c1), cmul, co(c6, cmul, c2))), clt, co(co(co(c6, cexp, nat2), cmul, co(co(c8, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c1, cexp, nat2))), caddc, co(co(c5, cexp, nat2), cmul, co(co(c8, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c2, cexp, nat2))))))
  4casesdan(w0, wbr(co(nat2, cmul, co(co(c5, cmul, c1), cmul, co(c6, cmul, c2))), clt, co(co(co(c6, cexp, nat2), cmul, co(co(c8, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c1, cexp, nat2))), caddc, co(co(c5, cexp, nat2), cmul, co(co(c8, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c2, cexp, nat2))))), wne(c2, c4), wne(c1, c3))

blocks.name: itscnhlinecirc02p
blocks.content: Intersection of a nonhorizontal line with a circle: A nonhorizontal line passing through a point within a circle around the origin intersects the circle at exactly two different points. (Contributed by AV, 28-Jan-2023.)

blocks.name: inlinecirc02p
blocks.content: Intersection of a line with a circle: A line passing through a point within a circle around the origin intersects the circle at exactly two different points. (Contributed by AV, 9-May-2023.) (Revised by AV, 16-May-2023.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: inlinecirc02preu
blocks.content: Intersection of a line with a circle: A line passing through a point within a circle around the origin intersects the circle at exactly two different points, expressed with restricted uniqueness (and without the definition of proper pairs). (Contributed by AV, 16-May-2023.)
blocks.origin:
